subject: Avoiding Hard coded locations
msgSnippet: Hi all, This question is about making your junit test s extremely reusable, i want my tests to run even if my code is down loaded by someone else and this
messageBody:
Hi all,
This question is about making your junit test's extremely reusable, i
want my tests to run even if my code is down loaded by someone else and
this means i want to avoid hard coding in locations.
I am currently working on a system which uses a SAX parser, to test it I
need access to the file system to get the xml files but i don't want to
hard code in the dir. I have looked a lot of places for the answer, and
i can't find a solution to my problem. I have read the Junit best
practices article (It deals with this issue) but it doesn't answer my
specific question. I want to get access to a directory? Has anyone come
across this problem?
Does anyone have any advice or ideas on where to look?
Cheer's,
Cormac
